str2: In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: To be weak (physically: then morally), To be sick. From asthenes; to be feeble.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
To be dying, be about to die, wither, decay. From apo and thnesko; to die off.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To put, place, lay, set, fix, establish. A prolonged form of a primary theo to place.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Neuter of a derivative of huper; a higher part of the house, i.e. Apartment in the third story.
